thread.title: Marianas gearing up for Japan’s largest annual travel show
thread.title_full: Marianas gearing up for Japan’s largest annual travel show

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Marianas gearing up for Japan’s largest annual travel show
text:
Marianas gearing up for Japan’s largest annual travel show   
Sep 20, 2015 Miss Marianas Jian Joyner will also participate in JATA Tourism Expo eTN   
The Marianas Visitors Authority is gearing up to again join Japan’s largest annual travel show — JATA Tourism Expo 2015. 
JATA Tourism Expo 2015 will be held at Tokyo Big Sight on Sept. 25-27, 2015. Exhibitors provide the latest tourism information to visitors and professional members of the travel trade. Last year, the showcase attracted over 157,000 attendees. 
“JATA Tourism Expo is just one part of the MVA’s marketing strategy to attract Japanese visitors to Saipan, Tinian and Rota,” said MVA Managing Director Perry Tenorio. “It’s essential to keep our presence in Japan, which is why the MVA has participated in JATA for many years and why it’s crucial to keep MVA funding intact. Less funding means less marketing and fewer visitors….and that means less revenue for all the government and the whole CNMI economy.” 
JATA Tourism Expo is internationally recognized as one of the largest travel events in the world. MVA will have an informational booth and present cultural demonstrations. Miss Marianas Jian Joyner will also participate.
